snippet: "With the benefit of hindsight, monetary policy needed to be still more aggressive," William C. Dudley, vice chairman of the Fed's policy-making committee, says in a speech.
abstract: "With the benefit of hindsight, monetary policy needed to be still more aggressive," William C. Dudley, vice chairman of the Fed's policy-making committee, says in a speech.

headline.main: Fed Official Says Monetary Steps Were Too Timid
